dmca.title: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Fake website hosted by The Planet]
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf Of
The Planet Policy Enforcement
Sent: Monday, March 06, 2006 3:35 PM
To: Tim.Weston@visitbritain.org; copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Fake website hosted by The Planet]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject:         [ABUSE] Fake website hosted by The Planet
Date:         Mon, 6 Mar 2006 08:26:12 -0000
From:         Tim Weston <Tim.Weston@visitbritain.org>
To:         <abuse@theplanet.com>



Hello?



I?m writing to bring your attention to a website hosted by your company,
http://www.travelsinfo.co.uk/en/visitengland/default.htm  , this website
uses content and imagery which has been harvested directly from an official
tourism marketing website operated by VisitBritain, the official UK tourism
marketing organisation.



Our official site http://www.enjoyengland.com <http://www.enjoyengland.com/>
has been updated in the past few weeks to incorporate some new branding so
the two sites no longer appear identical but the fake site nonetheless seeks
to impersonate the official site.



I am particularly worried about the intentions of those operating this fake
site, while the product searches and other core functionality don?t appear
to work, I?m sure that the capture of email addresses and other customer
data does with obvious risks to both the consumer and the reputation of
VisitBritain.



Please contact me at your earliest convenience to discuss this issue and how
we can address it quickly and efficiently.



*Tim Weston*

Technology Supplier Manager

**VisitBritain**

Tel: +44 (0)20 8563 3191 (direct)

Tel: +44 (07970 264575 (mobile)

Fax: +44 (0)20 8563 3134

Email: _tim.weston@visitbritain.org <mailto:tim.weston@visitbritain.org>_



www.visitbritain.com

<www.london2012.com>




VisitBritain - World's Leading Tourist & Convention Bureau 2005

_______________________________________________________________________
The information contained in this e mail and its attachments is intended
only for the above-mentioned recipient/s and, unless otherwise stated,
copyright of any material transmitted shall remain vested in this company.
The contents may also be confidential and/or protected by legal privilege.
If this is mail has come to you in error, please contact the sender
immediately to let them know. You are not entitled to make any use of it
whatsoever. We believe, but do not warrant, that this e mail is virus free
and you should take full responsibility for virus checking. We reserve the
right to monitor all e mail communications passing through our internal and
external networks.

- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.4.2 (MingW32)
Comment: Using GnuPG with Mozilla - http://enigmail.mozdev.org

iD8DBQFEDKrpvK/XpJs6oyURAjmeAJ99c5VEUzYrYsszgsItQr8IwRHqNgCgqWPY
1jCa93PLtzwy0J7p2VGCzOw=
=hlHO
